Comment: A record of information exchanged between two agents.

Describes a function or an action represented by a message. This term is defined by FIPA-ACL (SC00037) based on speech act theory which defines the functions of simply specified actions. For more information, please visit: http://www.fipa.org/specs/fipa00037/SC00037J.html
The action with which the sender requests the receiver to perform some actions.
The action of agreeing to perform some actions (without guaranteeing when).
The action with which the sender informs the receiver that a given job request is done, likely also the results of that job request.
The actual information exchanged between agents in a message. The receiving agent is responsible for understanding and processing the message content.
Indicates the state of a message.
The status that the message is already replied to and no longer active.
The status that the receiver of the message has not yet responded to the message.
A relation between a message and its targeting agent.
A relation between a message and the agent that created the message.
A relation between two messages that the later message follows up to the previous message.
A relation between a message and the communicative act used to classify the message.
A relation between a message and its actual content.
A relation between a message and its status.
A relation between message content and the known facts in the knowledge graph. The range of this object property usually is a list of instances.
A relation between message content and the desired output of the message request. The range of this object property usually is a list of concepts.
An attribute that indicates the time when the message was created or when the status of a message was updated.
